title: Pork Curry from the Box
ingredients: 2medium carrots, peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces
1large russet potato or Japanese sweet potato, cut into large chunks
⅓recipe Braised Pork (recipe follows), with the braising liquid, thawed if frozen
One 8-ounce box Japanese curry blocks (see headnote)
Fukujin pickles or pickled sushi ginger
directions: 1 Heat a Dutch oven or other large heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat, then coat with the vegetable oil. Add the carrots and potato and cook for 4 minutes, stirring regularly. Add the onion and cook for 2 more minutes to remove some of the rawness.

2 Use a slotted spoon to scoop the pork chunks into the pot. Now measure how much braising liquid you have and add enough water to total 5 cups of liquid, then add to the pot. Bring to a simmer, lower the heat to medium, and cook until the carrots and potato are nearly tender, 3 to 5 minutes.
3 Break up the curry blocks and stir them into the pot. (It’ll take some diligence to make sure they’re all completely dissolved.)
4 If you like your curry a little richer/sweeter, stir in the milk and honey. Simmer for 5 minutes, then serve over steamed rice with little piles of pickles on the side.
